questions.question: Which of the following is not a theory about how the universe started?
What is dark matter?
options: A type of light we cannot see
Something that glows in the night sky
Matter we cannot see, but it has gravity

questions.question: Which gas is most common in the Sun?
What tool do astronomers use to study distant galaxies?
What is the Hubble Space Telescope used for?
options: Taking pictures of distant space objects

questions.question: How many planets are in our solar system?
What is a black hole?
options: A place in space where gravity is so strong, even light can't escape

questions.question: What is a galaxy?
options: the Sun and everything that orbits around the sun
everything that exists throughout space and time
a huge collection of gas, dust, and stars and their solar systems, all held by gravity

questions.question: Which planet is tilted on its side?
What is a light-year?
options: The distance light travels in one year
The length of a year on Mercury

questions.question: What is the Kuiper Belt?
options: A place where astronauts go for training
A zone of icy bodies beyond Neptune

questions.question: What is an exoplanet?
options: A planet outside our solar system

questions.question: Which planet has the most moons?
What is found at the center of the Milky Way?
What did Nicolaus Copernicus discover?
options: the earth revolves around the sun
how the human body is structured
what satellites can go into easily

questions.question: What planet is closest to the Sun?
